dict.acceptation: 别的；其他的；（两个中的）另一个；其余的；
其他的；（指两个人或事物中的第二个）那个；（指一组中其余的人或事物）其余的；（指与说话人所在位置等相反的方向或地点）另一边；

sent.orig: There is no need for people to meet each other before they know each other.; You needn't be acquaintances to meet with each other.
If other people can do it, so can we.; What other people can do we can do, too.
sent.trans: 人家能做到的，我们也能做到。

sent.orig: Old and young cadres learn from each other and encourage each other.
sent.trans: 新老干部相互学习，相互激励。

sent.orig: The children compete against each other to reach the other end of the pool.
sent.trans: 孩子们互相竞争着抵达池子的另一端。

sent.orig: They oppose each other also complement each other.
